* From clue 12, the Spanish is to the left of the owner of the Guinea-pig. Since the Canadian is on the far right (clue 16), the Spanish cannot be at position 5, so it must be at either position 3 or 4. But from clue 2, the owner of the Horse is not to the left of Iced-tea, and since the French are already at position 3 with Iced-tea, the Spanish must be at position 4.
* From clue 11, Soy-milk is not to the right of Cola. So Cola must be at either position 2 or 4. But since Soy-milk is already at position 2, and from clue 5, the owner of the Horse is not Spanish, Cola must be at position 4.
* From clue 8, the Canadian is to the right of Cola, so it must be at position 5. And from clue 3, Coffee is not to the right of the Spanish, but since the Canadian (at position 5) cannot drink Coffee, the only one left to drink Coffee is the French at position 3.
* Finally, from clue 7, the owner of the Guinea-pig is to the left of the owner of the Snake. Since the Spanish are already at position 4 and the Canadian is at position 5, the only one left to own a pet that fits this description is the French, so the French must be the owner of the Guinea-pig.
